text: Athletes from the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia competed at the 2002 Winter Olympics in Salt Lake City, United States. ==Alpine skiing== ;Men {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Race 1 !Race 2 !colspan="2"|Total |- !Time !Time !Time !Rank |- |Marko Đorđević |Giant Slalom |align="center"|1:17.25 |align="center"|1:16.40 |align="center"|2:33.56 |align="center"|41 |- |Marko Đorđević |Slalom |align="center"|55.95 |align="center"|1:00.04 |align="center"|1:55.99 |align="center"|26 |} ;Women {|class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Race 1 !Race 2 !colspan="2"|Total |- !Time !Time !Time !Rank |- |Jelena Lolović |Giant Slalom |align="center"|1:20.54 |align="center"|1:21.50 |align="center"|2:42.04 |align="center"|40 |- |Jelena Lolović |Slalom |align="center"|58.87 |align="center"|DNF |align="center"|DNF |align="center"|- |} ==Bobsleigh== ;Men {|class="wikitable" border="1" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Sled !rowspan="2"|Athletes !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Run 1 !colspan="2"|Run 2 !colspan="2"|Run 3 !colspan="2"|Run 4 !colspan="2"|Total |- !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank !Time !Rank |- |align="center"|YUG-1 |Boris Rađenović Dalibor Ðurđić Rašo Vucinić Vuk Rađenović |Four-man |align="center"|48.66 |align="center"|28 |align="center"|48.79 |align="center"|30 |align="center"|48.97 |align="center"|24 |align="center"|49.13 |align="center"|26 |align="center"|3:15.55 |align="center"|25 |} ==References== *Official Olympic Reports * Olympic Winter Games 2002, full results by sports-reference.com Category:Nations at the 2002 Winter Olympics 2002 Olympics
